channel.title: Big Cat Rescue (Large MP4)
channel.description: Big Cat Rescue is an up-close look at the day-to-day operations, conservation efforts and the more than 100 feline residents of "Big Cat Rescue" in Tampa, Florida. This series will document their play, educate about conservation and show a side of the majestic animals you've never seen before.
channel.itunes:summary:
Big Cat Rescue is the largest accredited sanctuary in the world dedicated entirely to abused and abandoned big cats. We are home to more than 100 lions, tigers, bobcats, cougars and other species most of whom have been abandoned, abused, orphaned, saved from being turned into fur coats, or retired from performing acts.
Our dual mission is to provide the best home we can for the cats in our care and educate the public about the plight of these majestic animals, both in captivity and in the wild, to end abuse and avoid extinction.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Big Cat Rescue is the largest accredited sanctuary in the world dedicated entirely to abused and abandoned big cats. We are home to more than 100 lions, tigers, bobcats, cougars and other species most of whom have been abandoned, abused, orphaned, saved
channel.itunes:author: Animalist
channel.itunes:keywords: animal, animal videos, big cat rescue, big cat rescue florida, cat, cat videos, cats, cougars, cute, cute animals, kitten, large, lions, panthers, tigers, watch cats online

item.title: Pet FREAKIN' Tigers! - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Did you know it's legal to own tigers and lions in over half of the USA? ... These cats are born into a life of misery and many of them end up in the black market where they are killed for their body parts!
item.content:encoded: Did you know it's legal to own tigers and lions in over half of the USA? ... These cats are born into a life of misery and many of them end up in the black market where they are killed for their body parts!

item.title: Sand Cat Birthday Party! - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Canyon & Genie our sand cats recently turned 14 years old and what does every sand cat want for it's birthday? SAND of course! Canyon and Genie both got nice fresh sand in their enclosures along with a sand castle, tiny birthday present with catnip inside and a birthday MEAT cake to devour! :)
item.content:encoded: Canyon & Genie our sand cats recently turned 14 years old and what does every sand cat want for it's birthday? SAND of course! item.title: Can We Save the Tiger? - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Tigers are endangered... The wild tiger population has dropped 97% over the last hundred years, with only a few thousand remaining in the wild we must act immediately to save this incredible species.
item.content:encoded: Tigers are endangered... The wild tiger population has dropped 97% over the last hundred years, with only a few thousand remaining in the wild we must act immediately to save this incredible species.

item.title: Do Big Cats Like Water? - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: We all know domestic cats don't really like water? But what about tigers, lions and leopards? ... We decided to give kid's pools to some of our cats to find out!
item.content:encoded: We all know domestic cats don't really like water? But what about tigers, lions and leopards? ... We decided to give kid's pools to some of our cats to find out!

item.title: GoPro: Feeding Cougars - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Shot 100% on GoPro - Feeding cougars from the perspective of the animal caretakers at Big Cat Rescue in Tampa, Florida. You can see how quickly their demeanor can change once food is involved, these cats are wild animals and will never be tamed!

item.title: Big Cat Rescue - Making a Difference! - Big Cat Rescue Extras
item.description:
Lions, Tigers & Bobcats! ... Big Cat Rescue is the world's largest accredited sanctuary dedicated to big cats.
??Over the past 12 months we have rescued tigers, Kimba, Keisha and Zeus, Reise (cougar) and Jojo (serval/caracal hybrid) as well as two Florida bobcats (Fencer & Khaleesi) that we rehabilitated and released back into the wild!
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Tiger Medical Exam - Farewell Kimba - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Despite our best efforts, it was time to say goodbye to Kimba... In her short time here at the sanctuary this sweet girl had a big impact on BCR staff and volunteers. After all she had been through and how bad she must have felt, she always had a pleasant way about her and a "chuff" to share... Rest In Peace Kimba?1994 - 2014

item.title: Big Cat Popsicles! - Big Cat Rescue
item.description:
How do lions, tigers and leopards stay cool and refreshed during the summer? ... Big Cat Popsicles of course!
As part of our enrichment program at Big Cat Rescue we make our residents frozen treats that they really enjoy! These include bloodsicles, sardine martinis and poultry pops!

item.title: Foster Kitten Program - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Millions of cats, kittens, dogs and puppies are killed in shelters each year because they are deemed non adoptable... Often it's because the kittens and puppies are still nursing, or because the overcrowded conditions in the shelters causes illness before the animals can find homes.
item.content:encoded: Millions of cats, kittens, dogs and puppies are killed in shelters each year because they are deemed non adoptable... item.title: 3 Tigers Rescued from NY Sanctuary - Big Cat Rescue
item.description:
Big Cat Rescue saved 3 starving tigers from a New York "sanctuary" after they lost their USDA license and the animals were confiscated by the Sheriff's Department...
There are an estimated 10,000 - 20,000 privately owned big cats in the USA, cubs bred to be used as photo props and then sold as "pets" confined to tiny backyard cages, killed for their body parts and exotic meat trade or bounced around between different facilities.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Help Build New Wild Cat Enclosure! - Big Cat Rescue
item.description:
The bobcats, servals, caracals, lynx and JoJo the serval/caracal hybrid all want to go on "vacation" as well! ... In 2013 thanks to YOUR generous donations we were able to construct our 2.5 acre Vacation Rotation enclosure, complete with pond, platforms, new toys and lots of room for our cats to "run wild"...
Now we want to provide this same wonderful experience for our smaller species too!
Please help us make this happen for our small guys and girls! THANK YOU :)
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Angry Birds, Big Cats & Golden Eggs! - Big Cat Rescue
item.description:
NEW Angry Birds Golden Egg Levels Discovered at Big Cat Rescue! Watch tigers, lions, leopards, cougars and lynx, having fun searching for and DESTROYING their golden eggs! :)
HAPPY EASTER!

item.title: Global March For Lions - Big Cat Rescue, Tampa FL - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Global March For Lions 2014 - On March 15th, 15 countries and 62 cities with over 250 organizers, marched to raise awareness about: Cub handling, posing with cubs for photos, petting cubs and why that is always abuse!
item.content:encoded: Global March For Lions 2014 - On March 15th, 15 countries and 62 cities with over 250 organizers, marched to raise awareness about: Cub handling, posing with cubs for photos, petting cubs and why that is always abuse!

item.title: Never Turn Your Back on BIG CATS! - Big Cat Rescue
item.description: Tigers, lions, leopards and all other species of big cats are WILD animals, they will always have their wild instincts and as this video illustrates they will never make good "pets" !!
item.content:encoded: Tigers, lions, leopards and all other species of big cats are WILD animals, they will always have their wild instincts and as this video illustrates they will never make good "pets" !!

item.title: Lions - A Species Under Threat - Big Cat Rescue Extras
item.description: Lions are not listed currently as endangered, but their numbers are falling dramatically... Viable and enforced conservation plans are needed in order to protect this amazing species from extinction in the wild.
item.content:encoded: Lions are not listed currently as endangered, but their numbers are falling dramatically... Viable and enforced conservation plans are needed in order to protect this amazing species from extinction in the wild.
